Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Technique: ENGRAVED; ENAMELLED; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL
Name: Scarab
Description: Well fashioned scarab with depictions of the head, clypeus, prothorax, elytra and legs. The flat surface is carved with an entwining pattern encircling nefer and Ka signs.
